section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord, You are the Purifier of sinners - this is Your innate nature.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਧੰਨਿ ਤੇ ਵੈ ਮੁਨਿ ਜਨ ਜਿਨ ਧਿਆਇਓ ਹਰਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਮੇਰਾ ॥੧॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Blessed are those silent sages and humble beings, who meditate on my Lord God. ||1||

transliteration.text: dhann tē vai mun jan jin dhiāiō har prabh mērā .1.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

text: ਮੇਰੈ ਮਾਥੈ ਲਾਗੀ ਲੇ ਧੂਰਿ ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਚਰਨਨ ਕੀ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have applied to my forehead the dust of the feet of the Lord of the Universe.

transliteration.text: mērai māthai lāgī lē dhūr gōbind charanan kī .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

text: ਸੁਰਿ ਨਰ ਮੁਨਿ ਜਨ ਤਿਨਹੂ ਤੇ ਦੂਰਿ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This is something which is far away from the gods, mortal men and silent sages. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: sur nar mun jan tinahū tē dūr .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

text: ਦੀਨ ਕਾ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਮਾਧੌ ਗਰਬ ਪਰਹਾਰੀ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord, Merciful to the meek, Destroyer of pride

transliteration.text: dīn kā daiāl mādhau garab parahārī .

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - Naam Dayv seeks the Sanctuary of Your feet; he is a sacrifice to You. ||2||5||
